result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard H. Lobe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond to be applied to costs.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

to Forfeit Bond
Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Swayne.  Court reinstates previous bond with the same conditions.

May not possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribled by licensed provider.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON POSTING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am except for employment purposes or treatment purposes as approved by Bond Monitoring Program and must provide work schedule.
May not possess drug paraphernalia.
May not be present where controlled substance is illegaly sold or consumed.
May not have contact with known drug dealers or users.
Defendant can only be released Monday-Friday, 8am-3:30pm, so defendant can sign up for Bond Monitoring Program.
